summary: Division of a sequence of numbers
description:
Divides the first element in a sequential array of numbers by all other elements.

The computations should follow [IEEE Standard 754](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/4610935) so that for example a division by zero should result in Â±infinity if the processing environment supports it. Otherwise an exception must the thrown for incomputable results.

By default no-data values are ignored. Setting `ignore_nodata` to `false` considers no-data values so that `null` is returned if any element is such a value.

data.description: An array of numbers with at least two elements.

ignore_nodata.description: Indicates whether no-data values are ignored or not. Ignores them by default. Setting this flag to `false` considers no-data values so that `null` is returned if any value is such a value.

returns.description: The computed result of the sequence of numbers.

DivisorMissing.message: Division requires at least two numbers (a dividend and one or more divisors).
